Okay. A FTTN node. Has a port card in it for 128 homes.
It has a 2Gbit uplink right now. all the new ones sine december are 10gb. But lets use the 2gbit ones.
thats 15Mbit per a person. But you are assuming every home will have a connection they wont.
neither of my neighbors have net nor do a lot of ppl around me and most likely around you.
So there will always be excess capacity at the actual node point. No Node in Australia is full currently that he is aware of when i asked a mate at NBN.
Uploads are neglible on the system as come 6pm most ppl are pulling down. So we don't need to worry about that.
But as i said before. 90 percent of ppl will be facebooking or browsing. which all uses a quick speed to load the page data and then it's very light use after that just to refresh data headers.
Same for Youtube as it uses a G.2 Propierary algorithm youtube videos are very very small now. You can get a 1080p video with 3 mins length for less than 30MB on youtube now.
Same for netflix. used to be an hour video was about 2GB. Now with VP9 And HEVC(Yes it supports HEVC as of FEB for some devices) it's half that.
Ill go off the Node located 2FOE-22 (Forster-Tuncurry 22) Service Area 2FOE (Forster-Tuncurry ) Connectivity Service Area CSA200000000549 Connected Active 107. 18:27PM 3/22/2017 56.17 Percent.
So right now the most populated node in australia is even now at peak time using only 56.17 percent of it's capacity. and it's almost filled its quota As i said there is no such thing as node congestion.
Now when everyone starts rocking 4k TVs and shit then we can start talking about it.
Yes FTTN is shit. But blame NBNco not the little green box. If we had of had labors plan right now we would be paying 8.20 Per a Mbit in CVC prices as of may 2017.
We currently pay 15. that is the problem

That's still more server side. and you wont be putting them in a system more than once for a consumer. im talking next gen of harddrives for consumers.
Unless we just get cheap x8 PCI drives with 5tb capacitys.

I did a massive post on which ISP in australia are currently the best for peak hour speeds on the nbn with good CVC policys. to rehash
Aussie Broadband(Call early in the day to order ur service as they get really lazy after lunch as i think they go to the pub).
Currently has 35Mbit of CVC left over most days.
AusBBs. Shit pricing. But they have a very good CVC policy and they don't offer unlimited which helps keep the power users away.

Leaptel has a 90 percent speed guarantee that you will get 90 percent of the speed ur line can handle or you get a refund. they have yet to break this promise,service is very very good as well. Currently has 95Mbit left over even while they are getting hammerd
